Hello! My name is Andrés Zarta and I'm a Data Scientist from Bogotá. I work at Tu Libro a Ciegas (blind date with a book), a startup with a strong social responsibility that connects people with books. Both at and outside of work I like to sharpen my Python, ML and Deep Learning skills so I can contribute to cool projects. When I'm far from a computer I like to play with my dog and go hiking.

I got my Master's Degree in Operations Research back in 2016. My thesis centered around the generation of alternative rock basslines given a melody and a drumbeat using metaheuristics and optimization techniques. The paper can be found here if you'd like to check it out.

Latest Work

Book Cover Reader - Python

This tool was created for the book’s inventory management of Tu Libro a Ciegas using Google Cloud.

Take picture of book cover->Upload to Google Storage->Google Vision will capture the text->Google Books API request using the captured query->Book info (authors, isbn code, etc) and errors are logged into BigQuery

Feel free to use it, you only need a google cloud account.

Forest Cover Type Classification - Jupyter Notebook

(under development)

Exploratory analysis and predictive modelling on the Forest Cover Type dataset using Random Forest (pun intended) and Artifical Neural Networks.

Tags: Multiclass Classification, Random Forest, ANN

Pulsar Star Detection - Jupyter Notebook

Can we predict a pulsar star in the universe? Let’s use the HTRU2 dataset and ML techniques to find out!

Exploratory Analyisis / Outlier Analysis / Dimension Reduction / Classifier Comparison.

Tags: Binary Classification, XGBoost, KNN, NB and Logit

Mushroom Classification - Jupyter Notebook

Is a mushroom safe to eat or deadly poison?

Exploratory Analysis / Feature Importance / Feature Interpretation

Tags: Binary Classification, XGBoost, SVC, NB, Logit
